name: Overview
main:
In 2014, Islamic State (IS) took over significant portions of Iraqi territory, triggering mass displacement and severe humanitarian needs. After a military stalemate throughout much of 2015, government operations to retake territory from IS were stepped up in 2016 and are ongoing in 2017, aggravating displacement and humanitarian needs, such as health and WASH, particularly in Anbar and Mosul corridors.? Access constraints and human rights violations from all warring parties are of major concern.

Iraq now hosts three million IDPs, one of the largest internally displaced populations in the world.? Over two million IDPs have returned to their areas of origin, since October 2016.?IDPs and Syrian refugees make up 25% of the population in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KR-I).?

INFORM measures Iraq’s risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be very high, at 6.9/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 7.7/10 and 7/10 rates.?
latest_developments_past: 18/09: The referendum on Kurdish Independence scheduled for 25 September has been suspended by the supreme court due to complaints that it is unconstitutional and fears that it may hinder the fight against Islamic State. ?
latest_developments_upcoming:
25/09: A referendum in KR-I will be held on independence. The Iraqi government in Baghdad, and Turkey oppose the referendum. ? ?

06/11: Legislative elections will be held in KR-I.?
